entry.title: laying waste to my lovin' long ago
entry.summary:
Author: lcvnie

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,288Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 36

Summary: He watches Eddie turn and walk through to the check-in, a sinking feeling of deja-vu settling in his stomach. Buck knows he’s in people’s way by just standing there, but he feels rooted to the spot like a tree. He can’t, he won’t leave until Eddie’s gone.And like a small glimmer of sick, false hope, Eddie turns back to look at him from where the attendant is checking his bag, and waves at him.Buck feels like a dog being fed chocolate.orEddie moves to Texas; Buck suffers in more than one way.

entry.title: Hunger for you
entry.summary:
Author: LunaDusktreader

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,383Chapters: 27/36Kudos: 30

Summary: Buck has always known that the chemistry between him and Eddie was undeniable, but he never imagined that a simple moment of care could ignite such intense and forbidden desire. When Eddie begins to deal with the unexpected effects of lactation, the discomfort quickly turns into something new – a need that awakens unfamiliar sensations.At first, it is just an innocent touch, a gesture of support. But when Buck notices the way Eddie reacts, their gazes linger, their touches become more lingering, and the tension between them becomes impossible to ignore. Between hesitant whispers and bodies seeking each other, they discover a shared pleasure that scares and excites them in equal measure.What began as a moment of vulnerability turns into an explosion of desire and connection. But are they ready to accept what this means for the relationship they have built? Between surrender and uncertainty, Buck and Eddie will discover that, sometimes, hunger goes far beyond what can be controlled.

entry.title: a moment in a lifetime.
entry.summary:
Author: Idachen

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,084Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 10

Summary: “Buck Buckley?” he asked, his accent deeper now, rougher around the edges like morning gravel. “What are you doin’ all the way out here?”Buck had to mentally slap himself. Snap out of it, Buckley.Words. Use your words.“I was, uh… out for a run. Sir.”The ‘sir’ slipped out automatically. Was he still a ‘sir’ without the uniform?The man didn’t correct him, just nodded toward the bridge. “Don’t cross that thing. It’s more for show than use. Shouldn’t really even be standin’ on it. You got that?”orBuck is in trouble again, only this time Bobby seems to think that a little vacation from home would do him good.Bobby sends him to a kind of summer camp for adults, a camp whose existence Buck would have signed a petition against long ago if he had known about it.Nevertheless, he has no choice but to go to Texas for three months. But when he meets his very attractive instructors on the first day, he wonders whether the whole time there might not be so bad after all.(I hate summaries)

entry.title: Blue Pink White Pink Blue
entry.summary:
Author: Warlock_Nerd

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,359Chapters: 17/23Kudos: 349

Summary: Bobby noticed him first and went up to him. "Can I help you, young man?"The teenager shuffled forward. "I'm looking for Edmundo, Edmundo Diaz? He works here."Hearing his name, Eddie's brow furrowed. He stepped closer. At first, he didn't recognize the face. The sharp shape of the jaw, the curve of the mouth… then it clicked."Rachel?" He called, a question laced with surprise.The teenager straightened, "I go by Raphael now."***Eddie gets an unexpected visitor one day on shift, it’s his little cousin who needs a place to stay after getting kicked out by his parents :3 Just so everything is clear. This happens in an alternate universe where season 8 happened a lot differently. Bobby is alive and well, Eddie and Chris never went to Texas, the whole Kim Marisol thing never happened and Buck lives with Eddie due to the loft disappearing or something. (Shh. Don’t read too much into it.)Chris is 14.Enjoy :3

entry.title: Westbound
entry.summary:
Author: MidnightDraft

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 55,026Chapters: 21/21Kudos: 41

Summary: Right after the season 8 finale, Buck leaves Los Angeles for Santa Monica. Choosing a new home, new friends, and finally, himself. Eddie doesn’t understand why Buck pulled away, and the silence drives him to the edge. But feelings don’t disappear with distance, and eventually, Eddie has to face what he's been avoiding all along. What follows is his clumsy, heartfelt attempt to win Buck back.or...Buck accepts his feelings and moves away, leaving Eddie confused and realizing what he’s lost. Now, Eddie must find a way to win Buck back.

entry.title: No Grave Can Hold My Body Down (I'll Crawl Back To Her)
entry.summary:
Author: falling_star13

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,641Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 44

Summary: I’m using all the headcanonsBobby breaks out of a government facility, and can’t remember anything but he remembers someone important to him. Athena. And somewhere. The 118 firehouse in Los Angeles. With no memories he finds his way to the 118 asking for AthenaThe 118 crew make it their mission to get Bobby’s memories back. Athena makes it her mission to find who took her husband and how to make sure they never do it again.Eddie and Buck are still living together, and Eddie has been trying to tell Buck he’s in love with him. It’s not working.Somehow Karen ends up ropes into helping Athena.Maddie is on mat leave so when Bobby can’t be at the firehouse or at home, he hangs out with her and she gets to introduce her son to his namesake. Chimney is handling this well.Hen is trying really hard to manage all the chaos.Ravi is a main and gets to get in on all the insanity.Bobby thinks Buck is his kid and no one corrects him.All that and more. Fluff, angst, hijinx. let’s have some fun

entry.title: The Quiet Between Them
entry.summary:
Author: WhereFirefliesLand

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,189Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 367

Summary: Buck's used to being loud and taking up space. But lately, it feels like everyone else is talking without him. Tommy's too busy with his newfound popularity. Eddie's laughing more and spending more time with Tommy. And Buck–Buck's still trying to catch up to a conversation that keeps moving without him. There's something growing in the quiet between them. He just doesn't know what it means yet.

entry.title: Is a heavy heart too much to hold?
entry.summary:
Author: mielydrama

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,266Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 33

Summary: He hated the end of the day for months. Scared, destined to relive his own kinds of deaths over and over again. Then, worse, he had to watch his loved ones dying without a single possibility of saving them. Everyone, but Chris and Eddie were so much more recurrent.Now it wasn’t so different but at least he isn’t alone anymore.Now he is waiting for the night to come faster.OR; Buck has painful nightmares after Bobby dies, too scared of losing some of the people he loves.Eddie listens to him screaming every night. And offers to help, sharing the bed.

entry.title: and I found love where it wasn't supposed to be (right in front of me)
entry.summary:
Author: Lamiiue

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,970Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 136

Summary: Once Buck disappeared down the hall, Eddie looked at Chris with exaggerated offense. “I save your Buck’s life and all I get is ‘cool’?”Chris didn’t even look up. “You want a medal or something? You were just doing your job.”Eddie snorted. “Wow. No love for your heroic father, huh?”Chris finally looked up, grinning. “Hey, I’m impressed. But you shouldn't act like you did what you did for me. I bet you didn't even think about me when you saw him in danger.”“I always think about you.” Eddie defended himself.“You shouldn't.” Chris got up from the couch. “You shouldn't always think about me.” He repeated, softer now.“What’s that supposed to mean?”Chris gave a little shrug. “I know you always say everything you do is for me. And, yeah, I get it. I’m your kid. I’m important.” He paused. “But sometimes it feels like you use me as an excuse not to deal with your own stuff."orAfter Eddie brags about saving Buck's life, Chris knocks some sense into his dad, Eddie comes out to the 118, and another near-death experince forces Eddie to confess. Then they kiss.

entry.title: Because, it's Buck.
entry.summary:
Author: snailboat64

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,072Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 54

Summary: “Don’t knock sex and security. Almost everyone wants that.” Eddie said.“Almost everyone?”“Well, asexuals exist, Buck.”For some reason that makes Buck laugh.“What?”“Just wasn’t expecting asexual rep in your pep talk.”“I did a little reading about LGBTQ stuff. To, y’know, be supportive and try not to say anything stupid.”“For me?” Buck sat back so he could meet his eyes.“Well, yeah.”“Hen’s gay though.”“So? She’s a lesbian. It’s kind of more obvious to know how not to be a dick about that. A bisexual best friend is a bit more complicated. I didn’t want to fuck up.”-OR-Eddie needs to stop his chaotic efforts to cheer Buck up after his breakup with Tommy, and focus on repairing his relationship with Christopher. It's time. That should be the only thing he is focusing on, but a weird moment at the airport and a drunk voicemail from Buck give Eddie a whole new problem: how to act normal around Buck.Everything will get back to normal eventually, right?
